column4: I would just tell dbxwanderer "download. double-click. type host. click ok"
then dbxwanderer would say, "it keeps asking for a username and password"

I actually have a tutorial with screenshots for dbxwanderer --I sent it to my family in email.  I don't know if I still have it.  If I can package it and zip it over to dbxwanderer or post it somewhere (my web site is dusty and unmaintained), it might help.
that web 2.0 stuff?
Not sure what you mean -- I was making a joke about symantic.  (I don't believe in Web 2.0, not sure what it is or that it even exists. :P )
you know... the new symantic web
Heaven help us if Symantec is taking over the web!  :P
could be the synaptic web
does apt start sshd?
I don't know if it starts it.  I was going to tell dbxwanderer to type "ps -ef | grep sshd" , but thought it would be simpler to just run it --what the heck if there are two copies running.
where are you in this process?
oops. I meant dbxwanderer
I'm assuming that dbxwanderer has just installed sshd but hasn't yet started it running...
right. it would be nice to hear from dbxwanderer
Wow, you guys are more advanced than me.  I defer to your expertise.
dbxwanderer: grrr. no chkconfig
I tried that command -- "sudo: chkconfig: command not found"
By "ubuntu" I guess you mean the console?  Is that what it's called in GNOME?  Hmm.  (Don't bother answering, I'm just thinking out loud.)
no
Hey, where can I post a PNG file for people to see?  Is Imageshack any good?
no idean on web hosting
layers is a good place to start when people think yahoo is their browser
